intro: Melampyrum sylvaticum var. santicanum, commonly known as the Indian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces lens-shaped pods that contain several seeds, typical of the legume family. It is native to regions of Asia, including India, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
